SECTION 02:Trained Facility Staff Only in Last TWO - Years
U N I C E F
Does this facility have a functioning land line telephone?
Does this facility have a functioning mobile telephone?
Does this facility have a functional ambulance or other vehicle for emergency transportation for clients that is stationed at this facility or operates from this facility
Does this facility have access to an ambulance or other vehicle for emergency transport for clients that is stationed at another facility or that operates from another facility in near proximity
Is fuel for the ambulance or other emergency vehicle available today? (Enter response by observing)
What is the facility’s main source of electricity?
Central supply of electricity (e.g. National or community grid)
Other than the main or primary source, what is the secondary or backup source of electricity?
Central supply of electricity (e.g. National or community grid)
On the day of visit, is secondary source functional?
During the past 7 days, was electricity available at all times from the main or any backup source when the facility was open for services?
Often available (interruptions of less than 2 hours per day)
Sometimes available (frequent or prolonged interruptions of more than 2 hours per day)
What is the primary source of water for the facility at this time?
What is the secondary source of water for the facility at this time?
Is water available from this source on facility premises?
Yes, within the ground of the facility
Is there a toilet (latrine) on premises in functioning condition that is accessible for general outpatient client use?
Yes, common toilets for all patients
A visible signboard of the facility is present
The facility has client waiting area with ventilation (working fans)
Does this facility have any guidelines on standard precautions for infection prevention? If yes, ask to see the document
Does the facility have regular supply of masks?
What is the policy regarding mask wearing given the Covid-19 pandemic?
Please tell me if the following items used for processing of equipment for reuse are available and functional in the facility today.
Non-Electric Pot With Cover For Boiling / Steam
Please tell me if the following resources/supplies used for infection control are available in the general outpatient area of this facility today
Clean running water (piped, bucket with tap, or pour pitcher)
Waste receptacle (pedal bin) with lid and plastic bin liner
The health facility has leak proof, covered, labeled waste bins available in every treatment areas as per main 04 categories
Is fuel for the incinerator available today?
How does this facility finally dispose all four kinds of facility waste category sharps, non-sharps infectious, general non-infectious and Anatomical waste?
Burn waste through Incinerator within Facility
Burning of waste on flat ground without protection within facility
Burning of waste in protected PIT within facility
Burning of waste in unprotected PIT within facility
Dumping of waste on flat ground without protection within facility
Dumping of waste in protected PIT within facility
Dumping of waste in unprotected PIT within facility
Facility Waste disposed outside the facility in covered container
Facility Waste disposed outside the facility unprotected
M & E Officer / District Support Manager

During the supervision visit, did the supervisor assess the following?
Availability of Staff (As per Facility Need)
Training of Staff (As per Facility Need)
Data Completeness, Data Quality, Timely Reporting to Data

What Was the Name of Training or Content of Training?
What was the duration of that Training?
What was the Organization Name Who Conduct those Training?
Does this facility offer antenatal care (ANC) services?
Do ANC providers provide any of the following services to pregnant women as part of routine ANC services?
Intermittent preventive treatment in pregnancy (IPTp) for malaria
Monitoring for hypertensive disorder of pregnancy
Offers diagnostic laboratory tests as per FANC package
Please tell me if the following documents are available in the facility today: If available, ask to see the document
IPTp guidelines, check-lists and/or job-aids (including wall charts)
Have you or any provider(s) of ANC services trained in following:
Received any ANC training in the last two years?
What Was the Name of Training or Content of Training?
What was the duration of that Training?
What was the Organization Name Who Conduct those Training?
Does this facility offer delivery (including normal delivery, basic emergency obstetric care) and/or newborn care services?
Please tell me if the following routine interventions are carried out by providers of delivery services in this facility:
Administration of oxytocin injection immediately after birth to all women for the prevention of post-partum hemorrhage (AMTSL)
Monitoring and management of labour using partograph
Hygienic cord care (cut with sterile item and apply disinfectant to tip and stump, and no application of other substances)
Thermal protection (drying baby immediately after birth and wrapping)

Please tell me if any of the following interventions for the management of complications during and after pregnancy and childbirth have been carried out in the last 12 months by providers of delivery services as part of their work in this facility.
Parenteral administration of antibiotics (IV or IM) for mothers
Parenteral administration of oxytocic for treatment of post-partum hemorrhage (IV or IM)
Parenteral administration of magnesium Sulphate for management of preeclampsia and Eclampsia (IV or IM)
Removal of retained products of conception
Neonatal resuscitation with bag and mask
Antibiotics for preterm or prolonged PROM (premature rupture of membranes) to prevent infection
KMC (Kangaroo mother care) for premature/very small babies
Application of CHX gel on umbilical stump to newborn
Are the following documents available in the facility today: If available, ask to see the document
Any national guidelines for essential childbirth care (PCPNC)
Any check-lists and/or job-aids for Essential childbirth care (PCPNC or others)
Any national guidelines for essential newborn care (ECSB or ECEB)
Any national guidelines for Helping Baby Breath (HBB)
Received training in newborn resuscitation (HBB) using the newborn bag and mask in the last two years
Yes, Supportive Supervision or On The Job Training
Apart from newborn resuscitation, received training in essential childbirth care in the last two years (BEmONC Training on PCPNC Guideline)
Yes, Supportive Supervision or On The Job Training
Apart from receiving training in HBB & BEmONC, received training in helping baby survive including KMC guideline
Yes, Supportive Supervision or On The Job Training

If Yes: Please Ask To See The Log Used To Record The Temperature
Yes, Log Reported But Not Seen
Has The Temperature Log Been Completed For The Last 30 Days ?

Has The Temperature Been Out Of The Range 2℃ To 8℃ Inclusive In The Last 30 Days ?
Please Check The Temperature Record And Verify The Temperature For The Last 30 Working Days In Order To Answer The Question
Reported In Range But Not Seen
Does this facility offer any surgical services (including minor surgery such as suturing, circumcision, wound debridement, etc.), or caesarean section?
Please tell me if this facility provides the following services:
Episiotomy, cervical and vaginal laceration repair
Laparotomy (uterine rupture, ectopic pregnancy, acute abdomen, intestinal obstruction, perforation, injuries)

Does this facility offer blood transfusion services?
Does this facility obtain blood from a national or regional blood center?
Does this facility obtain ANY blood from sources other than the national or regional blood center?
Does any place in this facility do blood screening for infectious diseases prior to transfusion?
Please tell me if the blood that is transfused in the facility is "Always", "Sometimes",”Rarely”, or "Never" screened for any of the following infectious diseases.
Does this facility have a refrigerator available and functioning in this service area for the storage of blood?
Is the temperature of the refrigerator monitored at least once every 24 hours ?
If yes: please ask to see the log used to record The temperature
Has the temperature log been completed for The last 30 days?
Has the temperature been out of the range 2℃ To 6℃ inclusive in the last 30 days ?
Please check the temperature record and verify The temperature for the last 30 working days in Order to answer the question
Reported in range but not seen
Do you have any guidelines on the appropriate use of blood and safe transfusion practices?
Have any provider(s) of blood transfusion services received any training in the appropriate use of blood and safe transfusion practices in the last two years?
SECTION 7:-CHILD PREVENTATIVE, CURATIVE, & NUTRITION CARE SERVICES UNDER 05 YEAR
Does this facility offer preventative and curative care services for children under 5?
Please tell me if this facility provides the following services:
Provide ORS to children with diarrhea
Provide zinc supplementation to children with diarrhea
Administration of amoxicillin for the treatment of pneumonia in children
Treatment of malnourished child with RUTF as OTP
Treatment of malnourished child with Fortified dry rations as SFP
Inpatient care of malnourished child at Therapeutic feeding center

IMCI guidelines for the diagnosis and management of childhood illnesses

Any check-lists and/or job-aids for Oral Therapeutic Program (RUTF), Supplementary feeding program (Fortified Rations), and inpatient care

Of growth monitoring services for children received any training in growth monitoring in the last two years?
Of curative care services for sick children received any training in the community based management of acute malnutrition (CMAM) in the last two years?
Of curative care services for sick children received any training in OTP, SFP and inpatient care for malnourished children in the last two years?

Does the health facility have written Instructions / Guidelines on how to perform a data quality review or data quality check ? (OBSERVE)
Does the health facility conduct regular data accuracy checks (data quality self-assessment) ?
If yes, does the health facility have access to data quality self-assessment tools (paper or electronic) ? (OBSERVE)
Does the health facility maintain a record of health facility data accuracy self-assessments conducted in the past three months ? (OBSERVE)
Does the health facility maintain records of feedback to staff on data quality self-assessment findings ? (OBSERVE)
If the source registers and/or monthly reports are not completely filled in, what are the possible reasons for the missing data?
Presence of other vertical reporting requirements
If there was a discrepancy observed between the main source document and the monthly reports, what are the reasons for the discrepancy?
Information from all source documents not compiled correctly
Is there a deadline for submission of the monthly DHIS report by the health facilities?
If Yes, What is the deadline ?
Does the health facility record the dates of submission of monthly DHIS reports to the district
If yes, are the DHIS monthly reports submitted on time (before or on the deadline)? (REVIEW THE RECORDS AND CHECK THE DATES OF SUBMISSION FOR THE THREE REVIEW MONTHS)

Ask relevant staff in the health facility office to show up-to-date (i.e., not more than one year old) reports, documents, and/or displays that contain the following. The assessor should record the observations accordingly.
Aggregated/summary DHIS report within the past three months. (OBSERVE)
Demographic data on the catchment population of the health facility for calculating coverage’s. (OBSERVE)
Indicators (e.g., Penta3 coverage, ANC coverage and others) calculated for the health facility catchment area within the past three months. (OBSERVE)
Comparisons between health facility and district/national targets. (OBSERVE)
Comparisons of data over time, i.e., monitoring trends (e.g., for ANC, Penta3). (OBSERVE)
Comparisons of sex-disaggregated data (e.g., for Penta3, Pneumonia, Diarrhea and others).(OBSERVE)
Comparisons of service coverage (e.g., ANC, TT immunization, SBA). (OBSERVE)
SECTION 8:-INFORMATION USE GUIDELINES AND STRATEGIC DOCUMENTS
Are there written national/provincial guidelines on DHIS information display and use at health facilities? (OBSERVE)
Does the health facility have copies of the national/district strategic plans, health facility annual plans, and/or health facility performance targets? (OBSERVE)
Does the health facility prepare data visuals (graphs, tables, maps, etc.) showing achievements toward targets (indicators, geographic and/or temporal trends, and situation data)? (OBSERVE)
Yes, paper or electronic copies of data visuals observed at the health facility
If yes, what type of information is captured in the data visuals? (OBSERVE)
Neonate and child health care (other than EPI)
Top causes of morbidity and mortality
Did the health facility receive feedback reports from the district office / MOH based on DHIS information in the past three months? (OBSERVE THE REPORT AND CHECK THE DATE)
If yes, indicate the types of feedback reports:
Feedback on data quality (including data accuracy, reporting timeliness, and/or report completeness) (OBSERVE)
Feedback on service performance based on reported DHIS data (e.g., appreciation/acknowledgement of good performance; resource allocation/mobilization) (OBSERVE)
SECTION 11:-ROUTINE DECISION-MAKING FORUMS AND PROCESSES AT THE HEALTH FACILITY
Does the health facility have a performance monitoring or management team?
Does the health facility have routine team meetings for performance monitoring and/or management?
If yes, how often are the performance review/management meetings supposed to take place?
How many times did the performance monitoring/ management meetings take place during the past three months?
Were minutes of performance monitoring/management meetings maintained for the three review months of to ?
Did they have discussions on DHIS management, such as data quality, completeness, or timeliness of reporting?
Does the health facility have an annual plan for the current year?
If yes, does that annual plan use data from the DHIS for problem identification and/or target setting?
Does the annual plan contain activities and/or targets related to improving or addressing any of the following?
Coverage of services like ANC, delivery, EPI or TB
Gender disparity in health services coverage
How many times did the district supervisor visit your health facility over the past three months?
Did the supervisor check the data quality?
During the visit, did the district supervisor discuss your health facility’s performance based on the DHIS information?

MODULE J: QUALITY ASSESSMENT OF HEALTH CARE PROVIDER AT FACILITY
Please enter the Name and Designation of HCP to whom you observe for this section.
Verify by direct observation or by role play or by reviewing medical record
The provider receives and treats the pregnant woman cordially and respectfully
Provider Explains to the women about the 04 WHO-recommended schedule of ANC visits (1st visit: <16 weeks, 2nd visit: 24–28 weeks, 3rd visit: 30–32 weeks, 4th visit: 36–38 weeks)

The provider takes a FANC history, including screening for danger signs (Convulsions, Loss of consciousness, severe headache, blurred vision, respiratory difficulty, fever, severe abdominal pain, and vaginal bleeding)
Provider calculates the estimated date of delivery according to her last menstrual period at her first antenatal visit and documents it
Measures vital signs (blood pressure, temperature, pulse and respiration)
Listens to fetal heart sounds (after 20 weeks)
Determines fetal lie and presentation (after 36 weeks)
The provider requests diagnostic tests according to the FANC package
Basic: Blood group and Rh factor, hemoglobin, blood glucose, urine analysis for proteinuria, Hepatitis B & C, HIV.
The provider gives immunization according to national guideline (2 doses of TT among pregnant women)
The provider gives Iron and calcium supplements and folic acid
Give Mebandazole 500mg to every woman once in 6 months. Do not give in first trimester.
If you find “No” for any of the above statement then what is the reason;
Staff is not trained on guideline
Staff is not adequately skill to conduct the proper assessment
Increased Work load / Shortage of Time
Staff don’t consider this thing important
Please enter the Name and Designation of HCP to whom you observe for this section.
Verify by direct observation or by role play or by reviewing medical record
All women in labor are monitored with a partograph that is complete and accurate and manages properly.
AMTSL is performed for all women during Childbirth
If oxytocin is the uterotonics used for AMTSL at this facility, is reliable refrigeration available and used for oxytocin storage?
Thoroughly dries every baby, stimulates baby and covers baby’s head immediately
Delays cord cutting until pulsation stops (2–3 minutes) and applies CHX to the cord stump
Encourages mother to start breastfeeding within one hour of delivery
If you find “No” for any of the above statement then what is the reason;
Staff is not trained on guideline
Staff is not adequately skill to conduct the proper assessment
Increased Work load / Shortage of Time
Staff don’t consider this thing important
Please enter the Name and Designation of HCP to whom you observe for this section.
Verify by direct observation or by role play or by reviewing medical record
Wipe the mouth and nose with gauze, when head is delivered
Place the baby on clean dry towel or blanket on the mothers abdomen
Note the time of birth and sex of baby, and inform mothers
Record weight of the baby in record register and inform mother
Wipes the eyes and face and thoroughly dry the baby
Stimulates the baby while drying by rubbing up and down along the baby’s spine with the heel of the palm
Assess the baby’s breathing while drying and stimulating
If the baby is not crying or breathing well within 30 second of birth, clamp and cut the cord immediately and start resuscitation.
Remove the wet cloth and place the baby skin to skin on the mother’s chest
Cover the baby with a clean dry cloth including the head. Use a baby cap to cover head of newborn
Wait for 2-3 minutes after birth or until the cord ceases to pulsate, whichever comes first, before clamping and cutting the cord.
Tie the cord when the mother and baby are stable and after completing AMTSL.

Tie the cord with a ligature or place the disposable cord clamp, if available, 2 fingers (2-3 cm) from the abdomen, making sure the tie is firmly applied with two or three knots. Check for bleeding; if present, retie the cord.
Apply chlorhexadine gel on the cord, taking care to apply it on the base of the cord. Inform mother about applying same gel for 07 days
Instill eye drops (tetracycline or erythromycin), one drop in each eye.

Place an identification band, preferably two (one on the wrist and the other on the ankle of the baby). Noting the name of the mother and that of the father (where available), the sex of the baby, and date and time of the delivery.
Keep the baby warm, ideally by keeping him/her in skin-to-skin contact on the mother’s chest.
In case of a Cesarean section or if the mother is ill, wrap the baby well and cover the head.
Check the baby’s axillary temperature with a thermometer
Administer Inj. Vitamin K to the newborn and explain to the mother that an injection will be required to prevent hemorrhage in the baby.
Support the mother in breastfeeding her baby within one hour of birth and before their transfer out of the delivery room.
Monitor and record baby’s breathing, temperature after every 15 minutes for 2 hours, than every 30 minutes for 1 hour, and then every 1 hour for 3 hours.
If you find “No” for any of the above statement then what is the reason;
Staff is not trained on guideline
Staff is not adequately skill to conduct the proper assessment
Increased Work load / Shortage of Time
Staff don’t consider this thing important
SECTION 4:-History and General Danger Sign Assessment as per IMNCI
Please enter the Name and Designation of HCP to whom you observe for this section.
Verify by direct observation or by role play or by reviewing medical record
Ask age of child from his / her mother and record properly.
Ask or observe gender of child from his / her mother and record properly.
Ask if she has received care from another caregiver during this complaint.
Assessed height, and weight of child
Assessed nutritional status of child using MUAC tape
Ask from women about presenting complaint of Child
Ask about the duration of presenting complaint of Child
Ask whether child is able to drink or breastfeed?
Ask whether child vomits everything he/she has taken?
Checks whether child has lethargy or a change in level of consciousness?
Ask about the child vomits everything he / she has taken
If you find “No” for any of the above statement then what is the reason;
Staff is not trained on guideline
Staff is not adequately skill to conduct the proper assessment
Increased Work load / Shortage of Time
Staff don’t consider this thing important
Please enter the Name and Designation of HCP to whom you observe for this section.
Verify by direct observation or by role play or by reviewing medical record
ASK: Does the child have cough or difficult breathing?
ASK: For how long child have cough or difficult breathing?
LOOK: Does the child have fast breathing?
Count Child’s breathing with help from ARI Timer
Classify Cough and Difficult Breathing Properly
Identify Pneumonia through Fast Breathing and Chest Indrowing
Treat “Severe Pneumonia or Very Severe Disease” Through First dose of appropriate antibiotics or urgent referral
Treat “Pneumonia” Through oral amoxicillin for 5 days and If wheezing (even if it disappeared after rapidly acting bronchodilator) give an inhaled bronchodilator for 5 days
Treat “Cough or Cold” Through soothing throat remedies and If wheezing (even if it disappeared after rapidly acting bronchodilator) give an inhaled bronchodilator for 5 days
If coughing for more than 2 weeks or if having recurrent wheezing, refer for assessment for TB or asthma
If you find “No” for any of the above statement then what is the reason;
Staff is not trained on guideline
Staff is not adequately skill to conduct the proper assessment
Increased Work load / Shortage of Time
Staff don’t consider this thing important
Please enter the Name and Designation of HCP to whom you observe for this section.
Verify by direct observation or by role play or by reviewing medical record
ASK: Does the child have diarrhea?
ASK: For how long does the child have diarrhea?
ASK: Is there blood in the stool?
LOOK at the child’s general condition. Is the child lethargic or unconscious? Restless and irritable?
OFFER the child fluid. Is the child not able to drink or drinking poorly? Drinking eagerly, thirsty?
PINCH the skin of the abdomen. Does it go back: Very slowly (longer than 2 seconds)? Slowly?
Classify Diarrhea according to level of dehydration and duration properly
Identify dehydration level and identify appropriate treatment (Plans A, B, and C for giving fluids and food, Giving ORS for dehydration, Zinc supplementation, Ciprofloxacin for dysentery)
PLAN A – treat diarrhea at home
PLAN B – treat SOME DEHYDRATION with low osmolality oral rehydration salts (ORS)
PLAN C – treat SEVERE DEHYDRATION quickly with intravenous (IV) fluids
If you find “No” for any of the above statement then what is the reason;
Staff is not trained on guideline
Staff is not adequately skill to conduct the proper assessment
Increased Work load / Shortage of Time
Staff don’t consider this thing important
SECTION 7:-Counsel the Mother and Follow Up Care Provision as per IMNCI
Please enter the Name and Designation of HCP to whom you observe for this section.
Verify by direct observation or by role play or by reviewing medical record
Provide advice and counseling about hygiene of child
Provide advice and counseling about rest and activity of child
Encourage the woman to ask questions, and be sure that she understands what is being said.
Provide advice on follow up after 3 or 5 days (As per condition of child and classification of disease)
Give the Child vaccine on this visit IF NEEDED
If you find “No” for any of the above statement then what is the reason;
Staff is not trained on guideline
Staff is not adequately skill to conduct the proper assessment
Increased Work load / Shortage of Time
Staff don’t consider this thing important
Please enter the Name and Designation of HCP to whom you observe for this section.

The provider maintain privacy around the time, and patients confidentiality is respected
The provider not mis treat any client such as verbal abuse / discrimination / neglect or denial of services

Please enter the Name and Designation of HCP to whom you observe for this section.
Verify by direct observation or by role play or by reviewing medical record
The provider receive patients from community through LHW referral (Referral In)
Referral slips are appropriately placed safe in a box for referral In patients
The provider appropriately assessed before referral, and Refer is made without delay (Referral Out)

An up to date list of networking facilities in the same geographical area that provide referral care to clients should pasted on wall
If you find “No” for any of the above statement then what is the reason;
